title: Album Page, "Cloister of Cathedral, Verona", October 4, 1888
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: (inscribed in circle, perpendicular to drawing) 93; below drawing inscribed on ruled line: Cloister of Cathedral / Verona / Oct 4th 1888.
description: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  Depcted is an elevation of a polychromed building with a double arcade of Doric columns.  A single open window is above, the wall is capped by a terra cotta roof.  At the bottom edge of the sheet is a small plan showing a structure with double columns.  It is possibly this same building, but two columns are not visible in the elevation.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Cloister of Cathedral, Verona", October 4, 1888.
October 4, 1888. Brush and watercolor, graphite on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-163.
